Constructor Detail

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(double[][] data,
                         java.sql.Timestamp[] timestamps)
Parameters:
data - 2-dimensional array with accelerometer data for each axis. data[0] = x-axis, data[1] = y-axis, data[2] = z-axis
timestamps - the associated timestamps for the data samples

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(double[][] data,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         java.sql.Timestamp[] timestamps,
                         boolean removeOutlier)
Parameters:
data - 2-dimensional array with accelerometer data for each axis. data[0] = x-axis, data[1] = y-axis, data[2] = z-axis
label - class label for the given data
timestamps - the associated timestamps for the data samples
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(double[][] data,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         java.sql.Timestamp[] timestamps,
                         int arOrder,
                         boolean removeOutlier)
Parameters:
data - 2-dimensional array with accelerometer data for each axis. data[0] = x-axis, data[1] = y-axis, data[2] = z-axis
label - class label for the given data
timestamps - the associated timestamps for the data samples
arOrder - order of the AR-Model
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(java.util.Vector<Segment> ss,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean useAlternativeFeatures,
                         boolean removeOutlier)
Parameters:
ss - Vector with data segments
label - class label for the given data
useAlternativeFeatures - use alternative Features for the FV -> intended for non-segment data
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(java.util.Vector<Segment> ss,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean useAlternativeFeatures,
                         java.util.Map<java.sql.Timestamp,java.lang.Double> segmentationRates,
                         boolean removeOutlier)
Parameters:
ss - Vector with data segments
label - class label for the given data
useAlternativeFeatures - use alternative Features for the FV -> intended for non-segment data
segmentationRates - segmenation rates for the considered data. The i-th value is valid from timestamp i until timestamp i+1
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(java.util.Vector<Segment> ss,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean useAlternativeFeatures,
                         boolean removeOutlier,
                         int windowSize)
Parameters:
ss - Vector with data segments
label - class label for the given data
useAlternativeFeatures - use alternative Features for the FV -> intended for non-segment data
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter
windowSize - amount of samples to use for one FV

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(java.util.Vector<Segment> ss,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean useAlternativeFeatures,
                         java.util.Map<java.sql.Timestamp,java.lang.Double> segmentationRates,
                         boolean removeOutlier,
                         int windowSize)
Parameters:
ss - Vector with data segments
label - class label for the given data
useAlternativeFeatures - use alternative Features for the FV -> intended for non-segment data
segmentationRates - segmenation rates for the considered data. The i-th value is valid from timestamp i until timestamp i+1
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter
windowSize - amount of samples to use for one FV

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(java.util.Vector<Segment> ss,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean useAlternativeFeatures,
                         boolean removeOutlier,
                         boolean wholeSegmentForFv)
Parameters:
ss - Vector with data segments
label - class label for the given data
useAlternativeFeatures - use alternative Features for the FV -> intended for non-segment data
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter
wholeSegmentForFv - use the whole length of the segment as window size for the FV

AugmentedSignalFV

public AugmentedSignalFV(java.util.Vector<Segment> ss,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean useAlternativeFeatures,
                         java.util.Map<java.sql.Timestamp,java.lang.Double> segmentationRates,
                         boolean removeOutlier,
                         boolean wholeSegmentForFv)
Parameters:
ss - Vector with data segments
label - class label for the given data
useAlternativeFeatures - use alternative Features for the FV -> intended for non-segment data
segmentationRates - segmenation rates for the considered data. The i-th value is valid from timestamp i until timestamp i+1
removeOutlier - wheter to remove or not to remove outlier with a moving average filter
wholeSegmentForFv - use the whole length of the segment as window size for the FV

calcSignalMagnitudeArea

private double calcSignalMagnitudeArea(double[][] input)
calculates the signal magnitude area - a commonly used enery measure it takes the absolute values of all axis and sums them up

Parameters:
input - accelerometer samples for which to calculate the SMA
Returns:
the SMA value

calcTiltAngle

private double calcTiltAngle(double[][] input)
calculates the mean tilt angle for the given input samples

Parameters:
input - accelerometer samples for which the mean tilt angle is calculated
Returns:
mean tilt angle in the range of 0.0 and Pi

private double calcMean(double[] window)
calculates the mean

Parameters:
window - data to calc the mean
Returns:
mean of the window data

calcVariance

private double calcVariance(double[] window,
                            double mean)
calculates the variance

Parameters:
window - data to calc the variance
mean - mean value of the sample window
Returns:
variance

calcPeaks

private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> calcPeaks(double[] w)
Calculates the peaks of the given samples. According to the mean of the samples, the negative (if mean is negative) or positive (if mean is positive) peaks are choosen. The first and last sample of the given window are not considered for peak calculation.

Parameters:
w - sample window
Returns:
List with indexes for the input array. The samples at these positions are considered as peaks

calcAveragePeakAmplitude

private double calcAveragePeakAmplitude(double[] window)
Calculates the average peak for the given samples. According to the mean of the samples, the negative (if mean is negative) or positive (if mean is positive) peaks are choosen for calculation

Parameters:
window -
Returns:
the average peak (positive or negative) or 1.0 respectively -1.0 as defaul peak if not at least 3 peaks are present.

calcAxisCorrelation

private double calcAxisCorrelation(double[] axis1,
                                   double[] axis2)
calculates the inter axis correlation for two axes

Parameters:
axis1 - first axis
axis2 - second axis
Returns:
inter axis correlation
